intro: Prunus serotina f. phelloides, commonly known as the white-flowered black cherry, is a botanical variant of the black cherry tree. It is characterized by its white flowers that bloom in spring, contrasting with the typical pink or red flowers of the species. The leaves are typically oval and have a smooth, dark green upper surface. This form is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
